title: The One With the Evil Orthodontist

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't believe you would actually say that. I would much rather be Mr.Peanut than Mr.Salty.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No way! Mr.Salty is a sailor, all right, he's got to be, like, thetoughest snack there is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know, you don't wanna mess with corn nuts. They're craaazy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (looking out of the window) Oh my God. You guys! You gotta come see this! There's some creep out there with a telescope!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I can't believe it! He's looking right at us!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so sick.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I feel violated. And not in a good way.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How can people do that?... (All but Phoebe walk away from the window in disgust.) Oh, you guys, look! Ugly Naked Guy got gravity boots!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I am telling you, years from now, schoolchildren will study it as one of the greatest first dates of all time. It was unbelievable! We could totally be ourselves, we didn't have to play any games...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So have you called her yet?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Let her know I like her? What are you, insane? (The girls make disgusted noises.) It's the next day! How needy do I want to seem? (To the guys) I'm right, right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. Yeah. Let her dangle.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can't believe my parents are actually pressuring me to find one of you people.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, God, just do it! (Grabbing the phone.) Call her! Stop being so testosteroney!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Which, by the way, is the real San Francisco treat. (Calls her, then hurriedly hangs up.) I got her machine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Her answer machine?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, interestingly enough her leaf blower picked up.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So, uh, why didn't you say anything?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no-no-no-no. Last time I left a spontaneous message I ended up using the phrase "Yes indeedy-o."

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look look! It's Rachel and Barry. No, don't everybody look at once!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, they're just talking...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, does he look upset? Does he look like he was just told to shove anything?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no actually, he's smiling.. and... Oh my God, don't do that!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? What? What?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That man across the street just kicked that pigeon! (Rachel enters.) Oh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (bluffing) And basically, that's how a bill becomes a law.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh!... Right!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey Rach!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, it was, uh.. it was actually really great. He took me to lunch at the Russian Tea Room , and I had that chicken, where y'know you poke it and all the butter squirts out...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Not a good day for birds...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then we took a walk down to Bendall's , and I told him not to, but he got me a little bottle of Chanel ...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's nice... now, was that before or after you told him to stop calling, stop sending you flowers and to generally leave you alone, hmm?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right,.. well,.. we never actually got to that... Oh, it was just so nice to see him again, y'know? It was comfortable, it was familiar... it was just nice!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's, that's nice twice!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, what's going on? I mean isn't this the same Barry who you left at the altar?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Duh, where've you been?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but it was different with him today! And he wasn't, like, Orthodontist Guy, y'know? I mean, we had fun! Is there anything wrong with that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I have my reasons.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, how about the fact that he's engaged to another woman, who just happens to be your ex-best friend?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right. All right, all right, all right, all right, I know it's stupid! I will go see him this afternoon, and I will just put an end to it!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, the post-coital Barry and Rachel are recovering on the chair.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow... Wow!

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm not crazy, right? I mean, it was never like that.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Nooo, it wasn't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooh, and it's so nice having this little sink here...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, the post-coital Barry and Rachel are recovering on the chair.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there except Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (on phone, reading from a script) Oh, Danielle! I wasn't expecting the machine... Give me a call when you get a chance. (Rattles some dishes) Bye-bye. (Hangs up.) Oh God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's what you've been working on for the past two hours?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, I've been honing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What was with the dishes?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, uh.. I want her to think I might be in a restaurant.. y'know? I might have some kind of life, like I haven't been sitting around here honing for the past few hours.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (looking out the window) Look look! He's doing it again, the guy with the telescope!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God! (Walks to the window) Go away! (Gesturing.) Stop looking in here!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Great, now he's waving back.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Man, we gotta do something about that guy. This morning, I caught him looking into our apartment. It creeps me out! I feel like I can't do stuff!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What kinda stuff?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Will you grow up? I'm not talking about sexy stuff, but, like, when I'm cooking naked.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You cook naked?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, toast, oatmeal... nothing that spatters.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you looking at me for? I didn't know that.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there except Rachel.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, Rachel and Barry are getting dressed.]

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: What's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, it's just... Oh, Barry, this was not good.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: No, it was. It was very very good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, what about Mindy?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Oh, way, way better than Mindy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, not that, I mean, what about you and Mindy?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Well, if you want, I'll just—I'll just break it off with her.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. No-no-no-no, no. I mean, don't do that. Not, I mean not for me.

dialogue.speaker: BERNICE
dialogue.text: (over intercom) Dr. Farber, Bobby Rush is here for his adjustment.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: (into intercom) Thanks, Bernice. (To Rachel) Let's go away this weekend.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Barry..! Come on, this is all way too..

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: We can, we can go to Aruba! When I went there on what would have been our honeymoon, it was, uh... it was really nice. You would've liked it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I had a bra.

dialogue.speaker: BOBBY
dialogue.text: Hey, Dr. Farber.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: All right Miss Green, everything looks fine... Yep, I think we're starting to see some real progress here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: BOBBY
dialogue.text: I'm twelve, I'm not stupid.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, Rachel and Barry are getting dressed.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler enters clutching his phone.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can I use your phone?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.. uh, but for future reference, that thing in your hand can also be used as a phone.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, it's working! Why isn't she calling me back?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe she never got your message.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know, if you want, you can call her machine, and if she has a lot of beeps, that means she probably didn't get her messages yet.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'don't think that makes me seem a little...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...desperate, needy, pathetic?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, you obviously saw my personal ad.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How many beeps?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She answered.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'see, this is where you'd use that 'hello' word we talked about.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not gonna talk to her, she obviously got my message and is choosing not to call me. Now I'm needy and snubbed. God, I miss just being needy.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How'd he take it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pretty well, actually... (Wandering into the kitchen.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (wandering in after her) Uh, Rach... how come you have dental floss in your hair?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, do I?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (in a low voice) We ended up having sex in his chair.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You had sex in his chair ?!... I said that a little too loudly, didn't I?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You-you had what?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sex in his chair.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, uh... what were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know! I mean, we still care about each other. There's a history there. 'S'like you and Carol.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No! No no, it is nothing like me and Carol!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Please. If she said to you, "Ross, I want you on this couch, right here, right now," what would you say?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If it helps, I could slide over.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's, it's, it's, uh, a totally diferent situation! It's, it's apples and oranges, it's, it's orthodontists and lesbi- I gotta go.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where are you going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (leaving) I just have to go, all right? Do I need a reason? Huh? I mean I have things to do with my life, I have a jam packed schedule, and I am late- for keeping up with it. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello? Hello?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hello?(Listens) Mindy! Hi! Hey, how are you? (Listens) Yes, yes, I've heard, congratulations, that is so great. (Listens) Really? (Listens) Oh. (Listens) Okay. Okay, well I'm working tomorrow, but if you want you can, you can, you can come by and... (Listens) Okay... (Listens) Great... (Listens) Great... (Listens) All right, so I'll, so I'll see you tomorrow! (Listens) Okay.. (Listens) Okay... (Listens) Bye. (Hangs up and sits down heavily.) Oh God. Oh God. Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So how's Mindy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, she wants to see me tomorrow...Oh, she sounded really weird, I gotta call Barry... (Does so, on phone) Hi, it's me, I just.. Mindy!! Mindy! Hi! No, I figured that's where you'd be!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler enters clutching his phone.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning.  Chandler is sitting and staring at
his phone.  Monica enters and creeps up next to Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Brrrrrrr!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hell is filled with people like you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) He's back! The peeper's back!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (ducking) Get down!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Get down?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...And boogie!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thanks, but I gotta go to work and get my eyes scratched out by Mindy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Relax. Y'know, she may not even know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Please. I haven't heard from her in seven months, and now she calls me? I mean, what else is it about? Oh! She was my best friend, you guys! We went to camp together... she taught me how to kiss..

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (intrigued) Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And now, y'know, I'm like... I'm like the other woman! I feel so..

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ..Naughty!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right, I'll see you guys later...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, hold up, I'll walk out with you. Now, Rach, when she taught you to kiss, you were at camp, and.. were you wearing any kinda little uniform, or- (Rachel exits and slams the door in his face.) That's fine, yeah...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm gonna go to the bathroom. Will you watch my phone?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why don't you just take it with you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, we haven't been on a second date, she needs to hear me pee?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why don't you just call her?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can't call her, I left a message! I have some pride.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No! (Calls) Danielle, hi! It's, uh, it's Chandler! (Listens) I'm fine. Uh, listen, I don't know if you tried to call me, because, uh, idiot that I am, I accidentally shut off my phone. (Listens) Oh, uh, okay, that's fine, that's great. (Listens) Okay. (Puts down the phone.) (to Monica) She's on the other line, she's gonna call me back. (He starts doing a little jig.) She's on the other line, she's gonna call me back, she's on the other line, gonna call me back...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Don't you have to pee?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: 'S'why I'm dancing...

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning.  Chandler is sitting and staring at
his phone.  Monica enters and creeps up next to Chandler.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving coffee as Mindy enters.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mindy.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Hey, you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, you.... So, what's up?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Um.. we should really be sitting for this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure we should... So.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Now, I know things've been weird lately, but you're like my oldest friend in the world... Except for maybe Laurie Schaffer, who I don't talk to anywhere, 'cause she's all bitter now that she lost the weight and it turns out she doesn't have a pretty face. ....Okay, I'm just gonna ask you this once, and I want a straight answer.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Will you be my maid of honour?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Of course!

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Oh that's so great!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Was that all you wanted to ask me?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: That's all!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohhhh!! (Mindy starts to sob.) ...What? What?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: That's not all.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh sure it is!

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Oh no, it isn't! No! I think Barry is seeing someone in the city.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um, what- what would make you think that?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Well, ever since we announced the engagement, he's been acting really weird, and then last night, he came home smelling like Chanel .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (draws back) Really. Mindy, if it'll make you feel any better, when I was engaged to him he went through a whole weird thing too.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Oh God! You see, that's what I was afraid of!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? What's what you were afraid of?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Okay, okay... when Barry was engaged to you, he and I...kind of... had a little thing on the side.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: I know. I know, and when he proposed to me, everyone said "Don't do it, he's just gonna do to you what he did to Rachel," and now I feel so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh... Oh, Mindy, you are so stupid. Oh, we are both so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (offers her arm to Mindy and she sniffs) Smell familiar?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Oh no.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I am so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: No me, I am so sorry...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (watches them for a while) Oh my.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving coffee as Mindy enters.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Ross are doing a crossword, Monica is cooking,
and Chandler is still staring at his phone.]

dialogue.speaker: FOUR LETTERS
dialogue.text: "Circle or hoop".

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ring dammit, ring!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, you know our phone's not working?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I tried to call you from the coffee shop, and there was no answer.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (investigating) I turned it off. Mother of God, I turned it off!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Just like you told her you did! (Chandler glares at her.) ... Just pointing out the irony.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, so listen, I went across the street and talked to the doorman- I got the peeper's name! Can I use the phone?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nngghhh!!!!!!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Can I use your phone? (On phone) Yeah, the number for a Sidney Marks, please.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: "Heating device."

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Radiator.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Five letters.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Rdtor.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, is Sidney there? (Listens) Oh, this is? (To the gang) Sidney's a woman.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So she's a woman! So what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, so what? (On phone) Look, I live across the street, (walking to the window) and I know all about you and your little telescope, and I don't appreciate it, okay? (Listens) Yeah, I can see you right now! (Listens) Hello! (Listens) If I wanna walk around my apartment in my underwear, I shouldn't have to feel like—(Listens)—Thank you, but... that's not really the point... (Listens) The point is that... (Listens) Mostly free weights, but occasionally..

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, my neighbor... (Listens) Yeah, the brunette... (to Monica) She says you looked very pretty the other day in the green dress.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: The green dress? Really?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, she said you looked like Ingrid Bergman that day.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (waves dismissively to Sidney) Nooo!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Ross are doing a crossword, Monica is cooking,
and Chandler is still staring at his phone.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, Barry is preparing his tools alone as Rachel enters.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey. Got a second?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Sure, sure. Come on... (Mindy enters) ...in...

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Hello, sweetheart.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Uh... uh... what're'you... what're'you guys doing here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, we are here to break up with you.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Both of you?

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Basically, we think you're a horrible human being, and bad things should happen to you.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry... I'm sorry, God, I am so sorry, I'm an idiot, I was weak, I couldn't help myself! Whatever I did, I only did because I love you so much!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh- which one of us are you talking to there, Barr?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: ....Mindy. Mindy, of course Mindy, it was always Mindy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Even when we were having sex in that chair?

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: (to Mindy) I swear, whatever I was doing, I was always thinking of you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Please! During that second time you couldn't have picked her out of a lineup!

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) You did it twice?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, the first time didn't really count... I mean, y'know, 's'Barry.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Okay...

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: (to Mindy) Sweetheart, just gimme- gimme another chance, okay, we'll start all over again. We'll go back to Aruba.

dialogue.speaker: BERNICE
dialogue.text: (over intercom) Dr. Farber, we've got a bit of an emergency here...Jason Costalano is choking on his retainer.

dialogue.speaker: BARRY
dialogue.text: Oh God... (Into intercom) I'll be right there, Bernice. (to Mindy) Look, please, please don't go anywhere, okay? I'll be, I'll be right back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay, we'll be here! Hating you! Did you see how he was sweating when he walked out of there? Listen honey, if I'm hogging the ball too much you just jump right in there and take a couple punches because I'm telling you, this feels great .

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Yeah... I'm pretty sure I'm still gonna marry him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?! Mindy, the guy is the devil! He's Satan in a smock!

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: Look, I know he's not perfect, but the truth is, at the end of the day, I still really wanna be Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber, D.D.S.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God.

dialogue.speaker: MINDY
dialogue.text: I hope you can find some way to be happy for me. And I hope you'll still be my maid of honor...?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And I hope Barry doesn't kill you and eat you in Aruba.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Barry's Office, Barry is preparing his tools alone as Rachel enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Y'know, ever since I ran out on Barry at the wedding, I have wondered whether I made the right choice. And now I know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aww... (They hug)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Big day.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, I'll give you this, Mr. Peanut is a better dresser. I mean he's got the monocle, he's got the top hat...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know he's gay?

dialogue.speaker: I JUST WANNA CLARIFY THIS
dialogue.text: are you outing Mr. Peanut?

dialogue.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogue.text: (entering) Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Danielle! Hi! Uh- everybody, this is Danielle, Danielle, everybody.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi. Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogue.text: Well, I've been calling you, but it turns out I had your number wrong. And when I finally got the right one from Information, there was no answer. So I thought I'd just come down here, and make sure you were okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...I'm, I'm okay.

dialogue.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogue.text: Listen uh, maybe we could get together later?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That sounds good. I'll call you- or you call me, whatever...

dialogue.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogue.text: You got it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: DANIELLE
dialogue.text: G'bye, everybody.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Bye.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whoo-hoo!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, there you go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Second date!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...I dunno.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You don't know ?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, she seems very nice and everything, but that whole thing about her coming all the way down here, just to see if I was okay? I mean,... how needy is that?
